docs.snippet: Intensifying Indian protests prompted the Obama administration to block a pipeline’s path in North Dakota.

headline.main: Facing Standing Rock Campaign, Obama Administration Blocks Dakota Pipeline Path

docs.abstract: Intensifying Indian protests prompted the Obama administration to block a pipeline’s path in North Dakota.

docs.snippet: On this week’s Modern Love podcast, the “Ray Donovan” actor reads a story of a husband who experiences his wife’s pregancy more acutely than most.

headline.main: The Modern Love Podcast: Dash Mihok Reads ‘A Path to Fatherhood, With (Shared) Morning Sickness’

docs.snippet: Financial Times, one of the pioneers of charging for digital content, is betting that speeding up its website FT.com will help it retain and grow online readership, Chief Executive Officer John Ridding told Reuters.

headline.print_headline: Financial Times Hopes Faster Website Will Boost Readership
headline.main: Financial Times Hopes Faster Website Will Boost Readership

docs.snippet: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate terrorism in Berlin and Ankara, Donald J. Trump’s 140-character nuclear policy, and where Santa really lives.

headline.main: ‘Not With a Bang, but With a Tweet’

docs.snippet: In the 25 years that have passed since Dec. 25, 1991, what opportunities to redefine world order were missed by the United States?

headline.main: Since the Fall of the Soviet Union

docs.abstract: In the 25 years that have passed since Dec. 25, 1991, what opportunities to redefine world order were missed by the United States?

docs.snippet: Roger Kaiser, who inadvertently caused alarm at the Metropolitan Opera, was sprinkling the remains of a friend at opera houses, the police said.

headline.print_headline: Fan’s Last Wish Led to Scare at Met Opera
headline.main: Opera Fan’s Last Wish Led to Terror Scare at the Met

docs.abstract: Man seen sprinkling white powder into Metropolitan Opera orchestra pit is identified as Roger Kaiser, Dallas opera fan fulfilling friend's final wish to have his ashes dispersed in opera houses around country; is not charged with crime for action that caused terrorism scare and cancellation of two Met performances.

docs.snippet: The mother of an Alabama high school student says her 17-year-old son was attacked and badly beaten after standing up for police.

headline.print_headline: Police: Arrests Expected in Attack on Alabama Teen
headline.main: Police: Arrests Expected in Attack on Alabama Teen

docs.snippet: A Michigan woman who decided to take a cross-country RV trip instead of undergoing cancer treatment has died at the age of 91.

headline.print_headline: Woman Who Opted for RV Trip Over Cancer Treatment Dies at 91
headline.main: Woman Who Opted for RV Trip Over Cancer Treatment Dies at 91

docs.snippet: Berlin bomb suspect Jaber Albakr showed signs of radicalization in Germany, posting jihadi videos online before traveling to the Islamist-controled Syrian city of Idlib earlier this year, his brother told Reuters.

headline.print_headline: Berlin Bombing Suspect Radicalized by Imams in Germany, Brother Says
headline.main: Berlin Bombing Suspect Radicalized by Imams in Germany, Brother Says

docs.snippet: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on Wednesday pardoned a military officer sentenced to a year in jail for criticizing him for attending the funeral of Israeli statesman Shimon Peres, an official said.

headline.print_headline: Palestinian President Pardons Officer Jailed for Criticizing Him Over Peres
headline.main: Palestinian President Pardons Officer Jailed for Criticizing Him Over Peres
